meanings.definition: A plural form of the word 'fascia', referring to a flat horizontal band or molding with a distinctive design.
meanings.sent1: The house had beautiful facias decorating its exterior.
meanings.sent2: The facias on the ceiling added an elegant touch to the room.
meanings.sent3: The facias on the cake were so perfectly crafted, they looked like tiny sculptures.
meanings.sent4: Her dress had intricate facias that resembled delicate lace patterns.
meanings.sent5: The artist meticulously painted the facias on the mural, each one unique and eye-catching.

meanings.definition: A plural form of the word 'fascia', referring to the front part of a building or structure that faces the street.
meanings.sent1: The facias of the building were adorned with colorful banners.
meanings.sent2: The facias of the shops along the street displayed their names proudly.
meanings.sent3: The facias of the houses seemed to greet the passersby with a friendly smile.
meanings.sent4: The facias of the storefronts gleamed in the sunlight, attracting customers.
meanings.sent5: The facias of the buildings stood out against the gray sky, brightening the neighborhood.

meanings.definition: A plural form of the word 'fascia', referring to a sheet or band of connective tissue beneath the skin.
meanings.sent1: The doctor explained the importance of the facias in supporting the skin.
meanings.sent2: The facias help hold the muscles and organs in place within the body.
meanings.sent3: The facias are like a hidden network that keeps everything in its proper position.
meanings.sent4: Injuries to the facias can cause discomfort and affect movement.
meanings.sent5: The facias act as a protective layer, shielding the body's internal structures.
